subject: intel: Fix initial MakeCurrent for drawables of multi screens
commitMessage:
intel: Fix initial MakeCurrent for drawables of multi screens

This patch fix a regression caused by commit 11baad35.

Multi screens share one context. When the first screen call
intel_prepare_render(), it will set ctx->ViewportInitialized to
true, so the following screens don't have chance to call intel
_prepare_render().
If all screens run following gl command:
eglMakeCurrent()
glClearColor()
glClear()
eglSwapBuffers()
The first screen can run above command successfully. But the
following screen will occur segment fault error on eglSwapBuffers().
Because when following screens run:
eglMakeCurrent() won't call intel_prepare_render(); the width and
height of Draw buffer is zero, this causes glClear() return early
without calling Driver.Clear(); finaly Draw buffer doesn't have
bo, so eglSwapBuffers() occur segment fault error.

Change-Id: Ib2513488eaa148d2ebd45a4aa19686aea8eab899
Signed-off-by: Xiong Zhang <xiong.y.zhang@intel.com>

subject: Allow EGL software rendering by building the EGL Gallium driver
commitMessage:
Allow EGL software rendering by building the EGL Gallium driver

We now build the EGL Gallium driver, which allows software
rendering (for usages like EFL applications with wayland_egl
engine on Weston e.g.).

We patch the source to allow building with latest Wayland.
We change the discovery order to make sure the hardware driver
(egl_dri2) will still be used automatically, and the software
driver as a fallback only.

Change-Id: I98d7caebbfbacc845e23b384765fc7a1adfc0a07
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

you know this won't work with efl - it blacklists known software drivers (checking renderer and version strings etc.).   efl should be falling back then to software itself on its own side (which is far faster).

Patch Set 1:

Hi Carsten and thanks for the review,

In fact, I think it uses the driver, because I am able to start EFL programs embedding GL contexts like this one :

http://www.tarnyko.net/repo/efl_gallium_egl.png

If I manually do "export ELM_ENGINE=wayland_shm" and re-launch it, however, it won't show anymore.

You have a valid point that the SHM engine should be preferred in these cases ; however in Tizen we force EGL by making the ELM_ENGINE var system-wide, because we depend on it for so many things. In this respect, having default software support still seems useful to me.

Patch Set 1:

ELM_DISPLAY=wl would be better. :) i just added ELM_ACCEL too (ELM_ACCEL=gl for example) so this way it'll either auto-pick the engine for wl or specifically pick a gl accelerated one.

Patch Set 1:

I totally agree ! So once we have newest EFL (still waiting for the IVI release yet) we would be able to do :

ELM_DISPLAY=wl
ELM_ACCEL=gl

so we can have the optimal wayland engine and still display a GL context.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Nice shot !

So should we put it on hold util efl-1.10 ? note I just pushed efl-1.9.2 in my latest branches ...

May we just open a bug to track when to merge it , and if we assume tizen run on controlled (limited) hw configuration...

Note I am granted to merge it if needed...

Patch Set 1:

Hi Philippe,

I don't think we need to wait for 1.9/1.10 to consider this :-) ; just when we migrate, we'll have other environment variables at hand to handle our usecase.

Patch Set 1:

i would not say gl == optimal engine. have a look at the memory footprint of mesa first. it may use a gpu to render, but comes at a massive cost. just run massif one day on an app using gl and see how much a gl context costs (in mesa).

Patch Set 1:

oh and manual is right - no need to wait. when tizen3 updates to efl 1.10 you'll just get better tools to use to get the display method you want with less side-effects. the new env vars is part of better support for wayland so that within a wayland universe, efl behaves just as sensibly ad in x11. not just about support for wayland, but making it a first class citizen.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Bump.
Please see related user problem/request on the mailing list :

https://lists.tizen.org/pipermail/dev/2014-May/002786.html
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/accepted/tizen/ivi/stable/20140526.115323 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

subject: change {without x} to {with x}
commitMessage:
change {without x} to {with x}

The display server based on X or Wayland, is now a choice of different profile in Tizen 3.0.
Basically and consistently, two macros were used "with wayland" and "with x".
Below summarize the combination of the macros:

| wayland |  x  | meaning
|---------------------------
|   0     |  1  | pure X11 platform(no wayland)
|   1     |  0  | pure wayland platform (no X11)
|   1     |  1  | wayland but X compatibility
|   0     |  0  | no X and no wayland

This method unifies the meaning and usage. Deploy this to mesa package.

Change-Id: Ie2074f326a3996d807c459ae44641c4c4d5e10f7

I have two comments here:

1. For that bug, maybe the root cause is why the /usr/lib/dri/updates/ is in the search list. By default, it should not be there.

2. As to this patch itself, I just checked the egl dri loader is sharing the same logic. You can check the dri2_open_driver() function in the egl dri2 backend driver. I would recommend you to submit this patch to the mesa-dev mail list to get some comments there.

Patch Set 2:

1. For that bug, maybe the root cause is why the /usr/lib/dri/updates/ is in the search list. By default, it should not be there.
in mesa spec, some one has added the search path with updates(dri and dri/updates). Basically he modification is fine. The issue is the code doesn't support multi-path. That is the key issue.
2. As to this patch itself, I just checked the egl dri loader is sharing the same logic. You can check the dri2_open_driver() function in the egl dri2 backend driver. I would recommend you to submit this patch to the mesa-dev mail list to get some comments there.
Yes, It should be the upstream bug. I will firstly bug fix this and then push the code to upstream.

Thanks for your comment.

subject: Put all removing x dependency things under "without x" flag.
commitMessage:
Put all removing x dependency things under "without x" flag.

Since IVI and Mobile will use same code base, to avoid blocking
any IVI build, put all removing x dependency things under
"without x" flag. This flag, for now, is only defined in build.conf
of mobile wayland profile. In the future, if IVI want to make a
x-free image, it can cherry-pick these "removings".

Change-Id: I12b163be42e85239743624b9f6e6ed6706f6349a
Signed-off-by: Alex Wu <zhiwen.wu@linux.intel.com>

subject: wayland: Don't rely on static variable for identifying wl_drm buffers
commitMessage:
wayland: Don't rely on static variable for identifying wl_drm buffers

Now that libEGL has been fixed to not leak all kinds of symbols, gbm
links to its own copy of the libwayland-drm.a helper library.  That means
we can't rely on comparing the addresses of a static vtable symbol in that
library to determine if a wl_buffer is a wl_drm_buffer.  Instead, we
move the vtable into the wl_drm struct and use that for comparing.

https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=69437
Cc: 9.2 <mesa-stable@lists.freedesktop.org>

Change-Id: I637889af561b939fcce9fa90637778e38e82dcd0
Signed-off-by: Kristian Høgsberg <krh@bitplanet.net>

subject: egl: Update to Wayland 1.2 server API
commitMessage:
egl: Update to Wayland 1.2 server API

Since Wayland 1.2, struct wl_buffer and a few functions are deprecated.

References to wl_buffer are replaced with wl_resource and some getter
functions and calls to deprecated functions are replaced with the proper
new API. The latter changes are related to resource versioning.

Change-Id: I1486ebb072cfe0929940b7de10a598fe97664e9f
Signed-off-by: Ander Conselvan de Oliveira <ander.conselvan.de.oliveira@intel.com>

subject: wayland: Handle global_remove event as well
commitMessage:
wayland: Handle global_remove event as well

We need to set up a handler for the global_remove event that gets sent
out when a global gets removed.  Without the handler we end up calling
a NULL pointer.

https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=65910

NOTE: This is a candidate for the stable branches.

Signed-off-by: Kristian Høgsberg <krh@bitplanet.net>

As far as the 3D driver is concerned, it's very similar to Ivybridge,
